page.title: 20TRANSPORT TO RAMSGATE
page.content: Ramsgate is well served by most forms of transport.Ships have always used the local harbour which has increased in size with the addition of Port Sally. The Port has berths for passenger and car ferries and container ships.The original harbour is large enough to take ships bringing in new German cars. The Inner Harbour has a yachting marina The first hovercraft service started here but moved to Dover.Air transport has always been available and is now concentrated at Manston military and civil airport.Railways run to London in two directions,through central and northern Kent.Road vehicles go to London via Canterbury or the Thanet Way on to the M2 motorway.National coaches run daily services to London and other parts of Britain.The East Kent Bus Co. runs the local bus services.
